sn46.52:1.1: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
sn46.52:1.3: “It’s too early to wander for alms in Sāvatthī.
sn46.52:1.4: Why don’t we go to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths?”
sn46.52:2.1: Then they went to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths, and exchanged greetings with the wanderers there.
sn46.52:2.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side. The wanderers said to them:
sn46.52:3.1: “Reverends, the ascetic Gotama teaches his disciples like this:
sn46.52:3.2: ‘Mendicants, please give up the five hindrances—corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom—and truly develop the seven awakening factors.’
sn46.52:3.4: ‘Reverends, please give up the five hindrances—corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom—and truly develop the seven awakening factors.’
sn46.52:3.5: What, then, is the difference between the ascetic Gotama’s teaching and instruction and ours?”
sn46.52:4.1: Those mendicants neither approved nor dismissed that statement of the wanderers who follow other paths.
sn46.52:4.2: They got up from their seat, thinking:
sn46.52:4.3: “We will learn the meaning of this statement from the Buddha himself.”
sn46.52:4.4: Then, after the meal, when they returned from alms-round, they went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
sn46.52:8.1: “Mendicants, when wanderers who follow other paths say this, you should say to them:
sn46.52:8.2: ‘But reverends, is there a way in which the five hindrances become ten and the seven awakening factors become fourteen?’
sn46.52:8.3: Questioned like this, the wanderers who follow other paths would be stumped, and, in addition, would get frustrated.
sn46.52:8.5: Because they’re out of their element.
sn46.52:8.6: I don’t see anyone in this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—who could provide a satisfying answer to these questions except for the Realized One or his disciple or someone who has heard it from them.
sn46.52:9.1: And what is the way in which the five hindrances become ten?
sn46.52:9.2: Sensual desire for what is internal is a hindrance; and sensual desire for what is external is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:9.3: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of sensual desire’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:9.4: Ill will for what is internal is a hindrance; and ill will for what is external is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:9.5: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of ill will’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:9.6: Dullness is a hindrance; and drowsiness is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:9.7: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of dullness and drowsiness’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:9.8: Restlessness is a hindrance; and remorse is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:9.9: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of restlessness and remorse’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:9.10: Doubt about internal things is a hindrance; and doubt about external things is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:9.11: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of doubt’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:9.12: This is the way in which the five hindrances become ten.
sn46.52:10.1: And what is the way in which the seven awakening factors become fourteen?
sn46.52:10.2: Mindfulness of internal things is the awakening factor of mindfulness; and mindfulness of external things is also the awakening factor of mindfulness.
sn46.52:10.3: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of mindfulness’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:11.1: Investigating, exploring, and inquiring into internal things with wisdom is the awakening factor of investigation of principles; and investigating, exploring, and inquiring into external things with wisdom is also the awakening factor of investigation of principles.
sn46.52:11.2: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of investigation of principles’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:12.1: Physical energy is the awakening factor of energy; and mental energy is also the awakening factor of energy.
sn46.52:12.2: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of energy’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:13.1: Rapture while placing the mind and keeping it connected is the awakening factor of rapture; and rapture without placing the mind and keeping it connected is also the awakening factor of rapture.
sn46.52:13.2: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of rapture’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:14.1: Physical tranquility is the awakening factor of tranquility; and mental tranquility is also the awakening factor of tranquility.
sn46.52:14.2: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of tranquility’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:15.1: Immersion while placing the mind and keeping it connected is the awakening factor of immersion; and immersion without placing the mind and keeping it connected is also the awakening factor of immersion.
sn46.52:15.2: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of immersion’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:16.1: Equanimity for internal things is the awakening factor of equanimity; and equanimity for external things is also the awakening factor of equanimity.
sn46.52:16.2: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of equanimity’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:16.3: This is the way in which the seven awakening factors become fourteen.”
